Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as exaggerating the extent to which the storming of the Capitol was staged, as there is substantial evidence and testimony supporting the fact that supporters of President Trump were involved in the event.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that the storming of the Capitol was staged. The provided evidence and testimonies contradict this claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the storming of the Capitol was staged without providing substantial evidence or logical reasoning to support this assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that the storming of the Capitol was carried out by supporters of President Trump, as supported by multiple accounts and evidence.
